title: Liam Gallagher puts his name in the hat to record Bond 25 theme song
text:
Liam would be down to pen a song about all that dying (Picture: WireImage)

Landing the James Bond theme is a badge of honour, with artists including Shirley Bassey, Paul McCartney, Carly Simon, Tina Turner, Adele and Madonna soundtracking the legendary films.

And Liam Gallagher wants in the club.

The former Oasis frontman reckons he could sing the theme for No Time To Die if he pens a song about, er, dying.

Speaking to Ireland’s Today FM, Liam said: ‘The new James Bond one, it’s all about dying innit.

Daniel is back to play Bond (Picture: Splash)

‘Die not next week, can’t be a***d dying today, might die f*****g next month, there’s a lot of death going on. But you know they can give us a call, why not.’

The 47-year-old added that while he doesn’t write music to appear in films, he’s more than up to have his songs on the big screen.

Liam – whose song One Of Us featured in Peaky Blinders – said: ‘Gone is a top tune, I could see that in a Tarantino film. If I could work with anyone? Tarantino, he’s pretty good, isn’t he. There’s a lot of him in Gone.

‘But we don’t write music to go, “Right let’s put it in a film”, but if people pick up on it then they’re welcome to it.’

Sam Smith won an Oscar for his song The Writing’s On The Wall (Picture: Kevin Winter/Getty Images)

Liam joins the ever-growing list of the artists who could provide the theme for Bond 25, which is out next year.

Ed Sheeran, Lewis Capaldi and Dua Lipa are among the favourites to provide the theme song, with Stormzy, Rag ‘n’ Bone Man, Ellie Goulding, Harry Styles and James Arthur also rumoured.

Sam Smith provided the theme The Writing’s On The Wall for the last Bond film Spectre, with the song winning the Oscar for Best Original Song.

Adele’s Skyfall also received the honour.

No Time To Die will be Daniel Craig’s last outing as 007, with Rami Malek, Ana de Armas, Lashana Lynch, Lea Seydoux, Naomie Harris, Ralph Fiennes and Ben Whishaw also starring.
